subject: RE: [junit] How can I get Junit Test to run in parallel threads?
msgSnippet: We have a product called Enhanced JUnit (hence my interest in JUnit extensibility issues) that (among other things) will disburse JUnit tests across threads,
messageBody:
We have a product called 'Enhanced JUnit' (hence my interest in JUnit
extensibility issues) that (among other things) will disburse JUnit tests
across threads, VMs, and CPUs for concurrent execution.
http://www.silvermark.com/Product/enhancedjunit/


^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
Mike Silverstein
SilverMark, Inc.
The object testing company
http://www.javatesting.com

> -----Original Message-----
> From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbr@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, October 02, 2002 2:55 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] How can I get Junit Test to run in parallel
> threads?
>
>
> So said tukhus on 2002-10-02
>
> >Am new to Java/EJB and would like to do a number of throughput tests
> >in parallel in seperate threads, to simulate simultaneous users
> >pounding away at my beans' methods.
> >
> >Can anyone recommend a package out there that will extend JUNIT to
> >provide this functionality?
>
> Rob, I don't have the answer for you, but I'd like to thank you for
> posing the question this way. EVERYONE PAY ATTENTION.
>
> "Can anyone recommend a package out there THAT WILL EXTEND JUNIT..."
>
> Beautiful. JUnit doesn't have to do everything, folks.
>
